references: The experiment quantitative results (DSC score) for cross-modal dataset are illustrated in Table 1, and the results in this table are the mean values of five cross-validation folds results. The target segmentation regions for cross-modal dataset include: Left Kidney (LK), Right Kidney (RK), Spleen and Liver in our experiment. We employ the Dice Similarity Coefficient (DSC) as the evaluation metric in this paper. As shown in Table 1, the proposed model achieves the highest performance in evaluation metrics on the four target regions in both of the MRI⟶⟶\longrightarrow⟶CT and CT⟶⟶\longrightarrow⟶MRI experimental settings. Specifically, with employing the ResNet50 based encoder, our proposed RobustEMD model achieves the best mean DSC score of 60.95% and 62.61% against other models under above two experimental settings, and outperforms the second-best models by 3.66% and 9.64% respectively. At the same time, the RobustEMD with ResNet101 based backbone also achieves the highest mean DSC scores over four regions segmentation, the results are 55.86% and 59.84% and outperforms the second-best method by 1.51% and 1.22%. Moreover, in the cross-sequence dataset, all of DSC score results are illustrated in Table 2, the RobustEMD still achieves the best performance on three segmentation regions including LV-BP, LV-MYO and RV under the two experimental settings. In details, under the experimental setting of LGE⟶⟶\longrightarrow⟶bssFP, our model with ResNet50 backbone obtains the mean DSC scores of 75.32%, 51.32% and 72.86% on three regions and achieves the improvements of 14.97%, 0.69% and 4.52% against the other method. And the RobustEMD also gains the highest performance under setting of bssFP⟶⟶\longrightarrow⟶LGE and outperforms the PATNet by 6.37% and 0.55% in regions of LV-BP and RV. Besides, in Table 3, the RobustEMD obtains the highest DSC score performance in the cross-institution dataset in Bladder, Central Gland and Rectum these three segmentation regions with ResNet50 and ResNet101 backbones under the two experimental settings (STBT⟶⟶\longrightarrow⟶TCIA-P3T and TCIA-P3T⟶⟶\longrightarrow⟶STBT).

S4.T4.4.caption: Table 4:  Details of mean DSC scores (%) of cross-modal abdominal dataset with the different settings of sequence length  n 𝑛 n italic_n  using the model backbone of ResNet50.
references: The length of sequence n𝑛nitalic_n has the significant influence in the matching accuracy between the support feature and the query image. In this work, we conduct the analysis of the different values of sequence length n𝑛nitalic_n on the cross-modal dataset under the CT⟶⟶\longrightarrow⟶MRI setting and MRI⟶⟶\longrightarrow⟶CT setting respectively. For simplifying the experiments and the convenience of comparison, we set all backbones of encoders in models as the ResNet50. As illustrated in Table. 4, under the setting of CT⟶⟶\longrightarrow⟶MRI, the mean DSC score of four organs increases with the value of n𝑛nitalic_n increasing from n=4𝑛4n=4italic_n = 4 to n=16𝑛16n=16italic_n = 16, where its value is from 61.84% to 62.61%. Then, the performance of model decreases to the DSC score of 62.07% with the value of n𝑛nitalic_n increasing to 64646464. Same as the CT⟶⟶\longrightarrow⟶MRI setting, model under the setting of MRI⟶⟶\longrightarrow⟶CT also shows to firstly go up and then down with the increasing of n𝑛nitalic_n value.

S4.T5.8.table:
l1subscript𝑙1l_{1}italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT l2subscript𝑙2l_{2}italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT Cosine Similarity ours
LGE⟶⟶\longrightarrow⟶bssFP 60.04 65.29 63.36 66.50
bssFP⟶⟶\longrightarrow⟶LGE 55.97 60.25 57.74 61.16
S4.T5.8.caption: Table 5:  Comparisons of different cost functions performance on the cross-institution dataset under the setting of  LGE ⟶ ⟶ \longrightarrow ⟶ bssFP  and setting of  bssFP ⟶ ⟶ \longrightarrow ⟶ LGE .
references: The cost for node transportation is essential in the matching flow calculation. In order to evaluate the performance of our introduce the boundary aware cost function, we conduct the comparisons between proposed cost function and the l1subscript𝑙1l_{1}italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT-norm, l2subscript𝑙2l_{2}italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT-norm and cosine similarity. The experiments are performed on the cross-sequence cardiac dataset under the LGE⟶⟶\longrightarrow⟶bssFP setting and the bssFP⟶⟶\longrightarrow⟶LGE setting, and all models employ the ResNet50 as the encoder backbone. Specifically, as illustrated in Table. 5, the proposed cost function improve the model performance under both of these two settings which demonstrates the effectiveness in resisting the shifts across different domains.
